properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense low pressure system continues to give rain to Kivalliq this evening. The rain has mostly tapered off at Arviat and will end at Rankin Inlet and Baker Lake by Monday morning. Showers will persist off and on Monday and Monday night in all areas, however further amounts will be relatively light. Whale Cove and Rankin Inlet have had around 10 to 15 mm of rain since Saturday afternoon, with another 10 to 20 mm forecast for tonight and lesser amounts on Monday. Baker Lake has reported 25 to 30 mm of rain since Saturday morning. A further 5 to 10 mm is expected tonight with lesser amounts forecast for Monday. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-05T15:59:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T01:39:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0637328041.2019
Area: Baker Lake, Rankin Region including Whale Cove
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms have developed along a cold front moving across northwestern Ontario. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe with wind gusts of 90 km/h and up to ping pong ball sized hail. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-08-05T05:59:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-04T22:45:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3359429250.2019
Area: Savant Lake - Sturgeon Lake, Sioux Lookout - Eastern Lac Seul, Dryden - Vermilion Bay, Ignace - English River, Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre, Armstrong - Auden - Wabakimi Park, Gull Bay - Black Sturgeon Lake, Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing poor air quality and locally reduced visibilities at times. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. When outdoors, if your breathing becomes difficult or uncomfortable, stop or reduce strenuous physical activities. If you experience irritation of eyes, nose or throat, shortness of breath or other respiratory symptoms, you should take action to reduce your exposure to smoke. If you are feeling unwell and experiencing symptoms, contact your health care provider for advice. Issued jointly by Environment Canada and the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services. For more information on air quality and your health, please visit the Northwest Territories Department of Health and Social Services at www.hss.gov.nt.ca/en/services/environmental-health/air-quality. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-08-05T15:34:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services, 2019-08-04T23:35:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2947391977.2019
Area: Wrigley Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:39 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-05T02:38:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-04T23:39:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2043073716.2019
Area: Ignace - English River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning, hail of 1 to 2 centimetres and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times are expected or occurring in the area. Thunderstorms with squalls to 40 knots are moving eastward across the northern half of the lake this evening. They should be east of the lake by 10.00 PM. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-08-05T03:26:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T00:27:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0690112311.2019
Area: Lake Nipigon
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:42 p.m. CDT (6:42 p.m. EST, 7:42 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. This cluster of severe thunderstorms is located east of Fort Frances, west of Atikokan and Lac La Croix, moving east at 30 km/h. This severe thunderstorm will be near: Atikokan around 8:00 PM EDT. Locations impacted include: Seine River Village, Banning, Lac La Croix, Steep Rock Lake and Atikokan. Radar estimates indicate that some areas have received 50 to 60 mm of rain with these storms. Localized flooding is possible. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-05T02:38:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-04T23:43:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3531789548.2019
Area: Seine River Village - Mine Centre, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:39 p.m. CDT (7:39 p.m. EST, 8:39 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. A cluster of severe thunderstorms is affecting the Atikokan to Lac La Croix areas and is moving east into Quetico Provincial Park starting near this evening. Radar estimates indicate that some areas have received 50 to 60 mm of rain with these storms. Localized flooding is possible. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-05T03:59:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T00:40:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1548942695.2019
Area: Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms have weakened or moved out of the region. The strongest thunderstorms have moved to the southeast into Northern Minnesota. ###

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:00 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. A line of thunderstorms moving across the Ogoki Post area will move away to the east of the site near 10:00 PM. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-05T03:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T01:01:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3069733735.2019
Area: Fort Hope - Lansdowne House - Ogoki

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:35 p.m. CDT (6:35 p.m. EST), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to ping pong ball size hail. A line of severe thunderstorms is located 80 km east of Pickle Lake in between Albany River and Attawapiskat River. This line is moving southeastward at 60 km/h towards Fort Hope and Lansdowne House. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures reaching 28 degrees Celsius combined with overnight lows near 13 degrees Celsius are expected for the next 2 days. A prolonged period of extreme heat continues with maximum temperatures exceeding 28 degrees Celsius during the day and overnight minimums remaining at or above 13 degrees Celsius. Temperatures begin to ease starting Wednesday. ### Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. To get more information: - Check the local news for health and safety updates. - Check HealthLinkBC online resources about heat-related illness and how to protect yourself at www.healthlinkbc.ca/healthlinkbc-files/heat-related-illness. - Call HealthLinkBC at 8-1-1 to ask about heat-related illness. Environment Canada and local Medical Health Officers expect an increase in health and safety risks from heat and are advising the public to take precautions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-05T14:48:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-04T22:49:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2115118998.2019
